Package com.cafean.client.validation

Interface ContextWriter

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractContextWriter, DefaultContextWriter
    public interface ContextWriter
    An interface describing a print writer that includes ExportContext support for use in a validation display.
    See Also:
    ExportContext, ValidationDisplayPanel, AbstractValidationWrapper

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void clear()
      Discards this writer's current contents and context in preparation for re-use.
      void close()
      Closes this writer and releases any system resources associated with it.
      void closeContext()
      Ends the most recently opened context and marks its end at the current writer cursor location.
      void ensureCapacity​(int minimumCapacity)
      Ensures that the capacity of the string builder back end is at least the given minimum.
      java.lang.String getContents()
      Returns a String containing the text that has been written to this writer.
      java.util.List<ExportContext> getContext()
      Returns the list of export context objects that have been added to this writer via calls to openContext(ExportContext).
      int getLength()
      Returns the number of characters that have been written to this context writer.
      void openContext​(ExportContext context)
      Marks the beginning of the given context at the current writer cursor location and stores the context.

    • Method Detail

      • ensureCapacity

        void ensureCapacity​(int minimumCapacity)
        Ensures that the capacity of the string builder back end is at least the given minimum.
        Parameters:
        minimumCapacity - the number of characters for which to ensure capacity
        See Also:
        StringBuilder.ensureCapacity(int)

      • clear

        void clear()
        Discards this writer's current contents and context in preparation for re-use.

      • close

        void close()
        Closes this writer and releases any system resources associated with it.

      • openContext

        void openContext​(ExportContext context)
        Marks the beginning of the given context at the current writer cursor location and stores the context.
        Parameters:
        context - the ExportContext to open
        See Also:
        closeContext(), ExportContext.open(int)

      • closeContext

        void closeContext()
        Ends the most recently opened context and marks its end at the current writer cursor location.
        See Also:
        openContext(ExportContext)

      • getContents

        java.lang.String getContents()
        Returns a String containing the text that has been written to this writer.
        Returns:
        a String containing the contents of this writer

      • getContext

        java.util.List<ExportContext> getContext()
        Returns the list of export context objects that have been added to this writer via calls to openContext(ExportContext).
        Returns:
        the List of closed export contexts

      • getLength

        int getLength()
        Returns the number of characters that have been written to this context writer.
        Returns:
        the number of characters written
